intro: Tidestromia suffruticosa var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tidestromia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It is a shrub-like plant with small, narrow, evergreen leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. This variety is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
